The internet for connectivity,

open API software. Well, what happened

That's the nature of money. But four slip

as a point of view,

The third bucket of protecting

think of even just in terms

of ensuring that if we buy
a crib for our children that it's safe.

If we buy a car that it
actually is safe on the road. So consumer protection
refers to things much broader

than finance. Investor protection is
the concept that, yes, we can take risk in markets.

We're all allowed to
take risk in markets. But that the markets themselves
and the issuers, the people

raising money, should explain
to us at least the material

pieces of information upon
which we would take those risks. And that the markets themselves
have a certain transparency

and we protect against fraud
and manipulation and the like. And then guarding
against illicit activity.

This is one that
we've really layered over the financial sector
in the last 40-odd years.

In an earlier era, 19th
century, earlier 20th century, we didn't have as much about
this, even though, of course,

we did guard against
bank robbers. But I'm talking about
illicit activity outside of the financial sector--

money laundering, terrorism,
and even sanctions. So these four slip [streams
in a sense, are there.

AI and policy in finance?

explainability; and privacy. And what we mean by that
